snippet: In 2008, major countries managed to come together on a coordinated course that averted a global depression. They seem unwilling to cooperate again.
abstract: News analysis; major countries that coordinated extensively to fend off the 2008 financial crisis seem far less willing to do so again; disputes among European leaders have intensified as the Continent drifts towards a new recession, and the weakness and unpopularity of many governments makes bold action unlikely.
lead_paragraph: In 2008, major countries managed to come together on a coordinated course that averted a global depression. They seem unwilling to cooperate again.

headline.main: In Economic Deluge, a World That Can’t Bail Together
headline.print_headline: In Economic Deluge, a World That’s Unable to Bail Together
